intro: Haberlea sperguloides, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
